title: National Music Academy: Music Lessons Newcastle
description: If you're looking for the best music lessons in Newcastle, look no further. We offer guitar, piano, flute, drum and singing lessons.

paragraph_text: National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

National Music Academy is one of Australians leading and most innovative music tuition schools. We take pride in ensuring we have the best teachers to provide students with the best music education and we are currently looking for new highly skilled musicians to join our fantastic team! At National Music Academy not only will you get to kick start a rewarding career in teaching but you will also get to join a family of talented and passionate musicians who share your love for all things music. We are looking for people who are:
Have a passion for teaching and helping students reach their goals

If you are interested in joining our team or want to find out more information please fill out the below form and attach a copy of your resume! At NMA we are looking for teachers of Vocals, Drums, Guitar, Dj’ing, Bass & Piano!
Our talented lessons are conducted one on one within the frame work of your school term calendar.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.
At NMA, we believe in providing premium tuition, first class service, valuable opportunities and industry leading technologies to our students.
To ensure we are able to do this, all of our students are subject to the same pricing structures and terms and conditions.
If you are interested in signing up with National Music Academy, we recommend taking some time to familiarise yourself with these policies to make sure the enrolment process goes smoothly.
CANCELLATIONS, MAKE UPS, CREDITS & REFUNDS POLICIES
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.
National Music Academy aim to provide holistic tailored music education through one on one tuition, as well as a variety of other opportunities for students to grow, learn and improve their craft.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

National Music Academy lessons run according to the NSW public school term calendar. This means that there are no lessons on state school staff development days, or public holidays, and these lessons will not appear on your invoice.
Lessons run from Monday to Friday in Newcastle, and Monday to Thursday in Maitland, from 2:30pm – 8:00pm. Lessons earlier or later than these times are sometimes possible by arrangement.

There are no lessons during school holidays, however make up lessons may be scheduled for the school holidays depending on teacher availability, and we may also run workshops and masterclasses during the school holidays, so check our

We currently do not offer weekend lessons. However, if you are interested in lessons on weekends, please fill out the below expression of interest form, and our team will be in touch if there is enough interest to start offering lessons on weekend.
How much do your lessons cost?
All the information about lesson cost and payment policies can be found on the
Do you offer a trial lesson?

To try a lesson before commiting to the term, we offer casual lessons (link to casual lessons page). These can be booked in one at a time, with no commitment to the term, so many students book a first lesson as a casual lesson, then proceed to book in the rest of the term as an ongoing lesson.
We also occasionally offer free trial lessons at our Open Days, so
to stay up to date with upcoming events.
If I have more than one child in lessons do I receive a discount?
Yes! If you have more than one child in lessons with us, or multiple members of the same family, we will waive the registration fee for the second student (and any further additional students.
It’s my first lesson, what do I need to bring with me?
For guitar, strings and woodwind lessons – please bring an instrument along with you if you have one. If you don’t have an instrument please let us know when you book so we can organise one for you.
For Drum lessons – please bring drumsticks if you have them.
For all lessons – bring a folder to keep any content from your teacher in. If you have a smartphone or tablet it may help to bring that along also so you can sign up for our lesson content app.
Can parents or a friend sit in lessons on the lesson?
We have an open door policy allowing family or a friend to sit in on lessons if they wish to do so.
Can a guitar be provided at your lesson?

We can provide a guitar for your lesson if you wish. We recommend if you have a guitar at home that you use this in your lessons, however if you are just starting out and haven’t yet purchased a guitar, please let us know upon booking so we can organise for a guitar to be provided for your lesson. We can also organise the purchase of a guitar for you!
What gear/equipment do you use in your lessons?
Our DJing lessons are taught on industry standard Pioneer CDJs and Mixers. If you have your own controller you are welcome to bring this along to your lesson and learn on that instead.

Our Drum lessons are taught on an acoustic drum kit at our Newcastle and Macquarie College Campuses. Due to soundproofing restrictions at our Maitland campus, drum lessons at that campus are taught on an electric kit. We also have a cajon at each campus for cajon lessons.
Our piano lessons are taught on full size electric pianos with weighted keys. Due to noise management issues, we do not teach piano lessons on upright or grand pianos.

We teach every style of music! Our lessons are tailored to the students’ interests and goals, so the styles of music you cover in your lessons will be selected by your teacher based on your goals and interests.
If you are interested in a specialist genre of music or style, please get in touch with us and we can find the best teacher to help meet your needs.
Do you teach students to read music?

We encourage students to learn to read musical notation. This comprises of tablature, music, rhythm and ear training. We do not solely focus on reading notation but combine it with what inspires you to play as part of your learning.
Do you offer AMEB and SUZUKI exams for students?

We offer all kinds of exams if students wish to sit these exams including AMEB, AMEB Leisure and CPM, Rockschool and Suzuki. If you wish to sit exams, please get in touch with our administration and we can help team you up with an experienced teacher for the exam you wish to sit, and organise books and exam fees for you.
All our students learn music theory in a way that is tailored to their goals and is engaging with their interests and repertoire.
Do all your teachers have Bachelors’ degrees?
Our teachers come from all walks of life, and all have unique qualifications and experience.
Many of our teachers have a Bachelor of Music qualification, or are in their final years of completing that degree.
Some of our teachers also have more advanced tertiary training, such as music therapy, education (primary or secondary), music business or sound engineering qualifications.

However, we train all our teachers in the NMA philosophy and methods to make sure that all our teachers have access to the best resources and know how to provide amazing one on one tuition that is tailored to the student.
We consider our teachers’ experience to be just as valuable as their qualifications, and every single teacher has years of experience in the music industry that they can bring to their lessons.
Do all your teachers have working with children’s checks?
Yes, all of our teachers and staff have current cleared Working With Children’s Checks.
What level and age can I start?
We teach from 5 years old right through to professional musicians who already gig.
We teach all levels and love seeing students grow and achieve their goals. Students who are under five can attend our
Can I pay for my lessons week to week?

We have Ezidebit available to all students who want to pay their lesson fees in instalments. Ezidebit allows for 3 or 4 fortnightly direct debit payments to be automatically debited from your account and makes sure that we are always ahead of the lessons in the calendar.
Ezidebit payment plans are easy to set up, and must be set up prior to or at the first lesson of the term.
Unfortunately we cannot accept sporadic cash or direct debit payments.
You can read all of our payment policies
Where can I read your policies?
to read our terms and conditions and policies in full.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

Here at National Music Academy, one of the things that sets us apart from other providers is the number of locations we have available for lessons, allowing us to provide musical education to students all throughout Newcastle, The Hunter and Lake Macquarie regions.
We have two dedicated campuses at Newcastle West and Maitland, both with convenient CBD locations that are easily accessible by car or public transport.

We also have lessons available at Macquarie College in Wallsend, within school hours, as well as after school for students who do not attend those schools but for whom the location is more convenient.

Finally, we offer in-school tuition for students at Macquarie College, Newcastle East Public School, Hunter School of Performing Arts, and in-school music workshops for students at Rutherford Technology High School and Maitland Grossman High School.

If you are interested in finding out more about any of our campuses please contact us. For tuition at Rutherford Technology High School or Maitland Grossman High School contact your school's music department.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

National Music Academy began in 1995, when founder and principal Gianni Michelini began teaching guitar lessons from his home. Back then, the focus was on providing amazing, personalised lessons for every single student, while Gianni’s mother would make each student waiting for their lesson feel like family with a warm smile and a plate of home-cooked spaghetti.

In the last 24 years, National Music Academy has grown to become one of the largest providers of music tuition in Newcastle and the Hunter, with the same focus on being dedicated to providing the best possible education to each student, and making every student and parent who walks through our doors feel like they are part of our family.

Our philosophy is simple – teach students to become musicians, not just to be able to play songs on their instrument. We want our students to learn music theory, technique, repertoire and performance in a way that is relevant to their goals, interests and level. While many others may claim to do this, 25 years of experience is the basis of the National Music Academy difference.

We now have over 400 students across Newcastle, Maitland and Lake Macquarie. We have hand-selected 30 of the best teachers in the area and trained them in this NMA philosophy of teaching the best music education with the passion and love that we would show to our own family.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.
National Music Academy is proud to offer premium tailored tuition at our Rutherford Campus. Our Rutherford Campus is available for lessons Monday-Friday, 3:30pm-8pm.

Our Rutherford lessons take place out of Rutherford Technology High School, and provides music lessons to students living in the greater Maitland area as well as the Hunter Valley and surrounds. With ample parking and accessible by bus, we're very proud to be a part of the musical community within the school as well as offer tuition to the wider area.

Our Maitland Campus is maintained with state of the art facilities and equipment. With four large tuition rooms, as well as upright and electric pianos, keyboard labs, electric and acoustic guitars and basses, as well as acoustic drum kits, we are very excited to welcome students to these new facilities in 2020.
The campus is also equipped with a waiting room for parents and industry standard DJ equipment for lessons.
If you are interested in tuition at our Maitland Campus please click the button below and we will be in touch to discuss your enquiry!
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

Our lessons are aimed at creating the artists of tomorrow. Our teachers have a wealth of industry experience from years of performing, recording, teaching and writing music, and will tailor a pathway for each individual student to make sure they have the knowledge and skills to build a career in today's music industry

Our ongoing and casual tuition is tailored to the student, built around each individual's goals and previous experience. Our teachers work in a variety of genres and styles, including classical, pop, rock, jazz, blues, world, metal, musical theatre, country and more. Regardless of whether you want to play for fun or are looking to build a career, our lessons will equip you with the skills you need

Our teachers come from a diverse range of backgrounds and each teacher brings with them a unique combination of education and experience. The one thing we look for in every teacher at NMA is passion for their craft and their students, and we have a dedicated team of teachers who are invested in the success of their students.
National Music Academy aim to provide holistic tailored music education through one on one tuition, as well as a variety of other opportunities for students to grow, learn and improve their craft.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

Our Lake Macquarie Studio is located at Macquarie College on Lake Road in Wallsend; catering for students from throughout the Greater Lake Macquarie area. We provide lessons before school and during school hours for students at the college, and offer lessons after school hours for all students, Monday-Friday, 3pm-5:30pm.

We are extremely proud of our affiliation with Macquarie College as we have been providing premium music tuition in the school for the last 10 years. Our services are open to the public after school hours and to Macquarie College Students during school hours, to provide students and parents with convenient options for times and locations for lessons.

If you are interested in finding out more about our tuition at Macquarie College, please get in touch with us by clicking the button below and one of our team will be in touch to discuss available options!
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.
All our lessons are made up of 4 key components:
TAILORED LESSONS INSPIRED BY THE STUDENT BUT CRAFTED BY THE TEACHER

​Rather than teach a set syllabus or curriculum, our teachers use the best teaching resources available from a variety of different sources, and create individual tailored lesson plans for each student.

This way parents and students have the advantage of proven, reliable and industry respected resources, with the flexibility of bespoke lesson plans and progressions. Your teacher will find out your goals and work out what theory, technique, repertoire and performance opportunities are appropriate for your level to help you work towards those goals.
These are then laid out in an easy-to-follow term plan that gives parents and students a clear outline of the plan for the term.

We also provide weekly feedback in the form of lesson notes, supplementary content (videos, audio recordings, sheet music and worksheets), homework and encouragement. This can either be emailed to you, or uploaded via our secure lesson portfolio app. This reinforces lesson content so that it is easy for students to practice at home, and easy for parents to keep up to date with what their children are learning.
National Music Academy is proud to offer premium tailored music lessons at our Newcastle campus!
Our Newcastle Studio is centrally located on King Street in Newcastle West; catering for students from throughout the Greater Newcastle area.
With two buildings each containing 6 fully air conditioned tuition rooms & a gorgeous waiting room; we endeavour to make your music lessons as comfortable as possible.
The Campus is also fit out with a performance space, recording studio and industry standard DJ & production facilities.
If you are interested in premium music lessons in Newcastle, look no further!
Please fill out the form on this page and we will be in touch to talk about your tuition requirements!
National Music Academy is proud to offer premium tailored tuition at our Maitland campus!
Our Maitland Studios cater for many of our students who are currently located in Maitland, Raymond Terrace and The Hunter Valley surroundings.

Our Maitland Campus located within Rutherford Technology High School provides The Hunter with our proven holistic tuition services, masterclasses, workshops & community services that have become the benchmark of The National Music Academy
National Music Academy is proud to offer premium tailored tuition at our Lake Macquarie Campus!
Our Lake Macquarie Studio is located at Macquarie College on Lake Road in Wallsend; offering in-school tuition for students attending
Macquarie College, as well as lessons after school (3pm-5:30pm) for external students in the Lake Macquarie area.
To find out more about lessons at Macquarie College please click below.
BENEFITS OF A GREAT RELATIONSHIP WITH YOUR MUSIC TEACHER
FOUNDER GIANNI MICHELINI ON THE IMPORTANCE OF NETWORKING IN THE MUSIC INDUSTRY
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

At NMA, we accommodate every student, no matter what their age, level, goals or interests. We welcome students if they have never touched an instrument before, if they have had lessons previously, all the way through to seasoned professionals looking to develop their craft further.

We accept students once they have started kindergarten for our one on one tailored tuition. We occasionally accept students younger than this, on a case by case basis. If your child hasn’t started school yet, we recommend trying a casual lesson before committing to the term.  We also have expressions of interest open for Early Childhood Music programs, which are run depending on numbers each term.

There is no age limit to joining NMA, and we have many adult students of all ages and levels. We believe you are never too old to learn something new so if you’ve always wanted to try your hand at an instrument or learning to sing, give us a call!

National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.
National Music Academy offers holistic artist development programs providing training & mentoring to foster musicians of all ages.

Music is made to be shared. We believe that part of becoming a good musician is not just being able to play at home or in your lesson, but being able to share your passion with others through performance. Learning how to deal with nerves, engage with an audience and develop stage presence are all key parts of our musical education, that can’t be practiced in a one on one lesson.

However, spending a whole year working towards one exam or recital can actually make nerves worse, and doesn’t prepare students to be musicians performing multiple times a week. We have different performance opportunities for students of different levels. We have 2 Live Lounges a term that are open to students of any level or instrument, and allows students a chance to get up and perform in front of a friendly, welcoming crowd. As students develop their confidence, we have regular opportunities for students to busk around Newcastle and Maitland, as well as in Sydney and surrounds. We also have an annual showcase, that allows students the chance to perform with a professional house band and gives our more advanced students a taste of working to an industry professional standard. Finally, we have paid gig opportunities for students who are ready to get a foot in the door as gigging musicians, which gives them valuable experience as well as a chance to earn income from their music. We’ve had students perform with artists such as
because they’ve been performing at professional venues and this has opened doors for them to play more gigs.
Check out our facebook events or Eventbrite below to see what gigs we have coming up!
